intro: Grusonia moelleri, commonly known as the slender rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, green, fleshy leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Grusonia moelleri thrives in rocky and arid environments, often found in alpine meadows and on steep slopes. Its ability to survive in harsh conditions makes it an important component of high-altitude ecosystems.
